constant pressure control(inverter)

structure of invertor washing machine

This system detects the present pressure in the plumbing from the check valve to nozzles. and the invertor adjusts the discharge volume of pump by controlling the motor R.P.M to be the desired pressure = present pressure.Therefore, the change of flow quantity by the number of the nozzle follows the change of the discharge volume of pump so that the water is always discharged under the constant pressure.

the big difference between inverter washing machine and normal washing machine

Example：11kw, 5 nozzles are used

Normal washing machine Inverter washing machine
Number of nozzles 5 pcs 3 pcs 5 pcs 3 pcs
Discharge Volume（l/min） 100 60 100 60
Power Consumption（kw） 11 11 11 6.6
Full R.P.M（min-1） 500 500 500 300
Water Supply Volume（l/min 100 100 100 60
Overflow Volume（l/min） 0 40 0 0
When invertor washing machine is used, the discharge volume from nozzles is decreased, motor R.P.M is adjusted by invertor and the discharge volume from nozzles is also decreased. No overflow volume. It becomes the economical operation. In case of normal washing machine, even the discharge volume from nozzles is decreased, the discharge volume from pump is not changed and unused water return to overflow. Therefore, it wasting the energy.

the merits of the introduction of the invertor washing machine

  1. Save electricity
    Electricity waste disappear.
  2. Reduction of the wearing parts
    Operation hours and R.P.M is less and wearing out is slow down.
  3. Installation space reduction Centralized control; because of 1 setting.
  4. Preparation time reduction The reduction of the time to prepare and clean up.
  5. Sanitation
    The appearance is clean because only 1 machine is installed.
